title: Attribution V2
description: Authorship, sources, provenance, and epistemic classification. Dublin Core-aligned with custom extensions for AI attribution and knowledge claim tracking.

creator.description: Primary creators/authors with intellectual property ownership (Dublin Core: dc:creator)

contributor.description: Secondary contributors who assisted but don't hold primary IP (Dublin Core: dc:contributor)

publisher.description: Entity responsible for making the resource available - e.g., conference channel, journal, platform account (Dublin Core: dc:publisher). Distinct from organization.

rights.description: License or rights statement (Dublin Core: dc:rights)

organization.description: Institutional affiliation of the creator - e.g., speaker's employer, author's university (custom extension). Distinct from publisher.

original_source.description: Original URL where content was published (Dublin Core: dc:source)

source_reference.description: Bibliographic reference for 3P content without formal authorship (custom extension)

agents.description: AI agents or tools used in creation (custom extension for AI attribution)

name.description: Name of the AI agent or tool

role.description: Role the agent played in content creation

publication_date.description: When the original content was published (Dublin Core: dc:date)

epistemic_status.description: Type of knowledge claim this content represents (custom extension for epistemic tracking)

concept_ownership.description: Who owns/coined the CONCEPT being documented, not the artifact (custom extension)
